intro: Acalypha wightiana var. ovata, commonly known as the woolly mallow, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Acalypha wightiana var. ovata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.

This plant thrives in humid climates and is often associated with secondary forests and disturbed sites. It is also present in some parts of southern China and the Philippines. Its distribution is largely restricted to the Indian Ocean region and adjacent tropical areas.
